Click this button to create a new soft key and add it to your phone.
Enter a label for the soft key. The label will display above the soft key.
Enter the name of the EFK function you want the soft key to perform. This action will be executed when you press the soft key.
If you want to view and edit the macro code of the EFK function, check this box.
Enter the macro code for the EFK function you want the soft key to perform.
The line keys that are currently displayed in phone UI.
Choose this option if you want to set up a line registration as a line key on your phone. You will be prompted to go to the Line Registration page, found also at Settings > Lines.
Choose this option if you want to add a BLF contact to your phone's line key.
This is the default Line Key Function. Choose this option if you want to add a speed dial contact to your phone's line key.
Choose this option if you want to add an EFK function to your phone's line key.
Enter the first name of the speed dial contact.
Enter the last name of the speed dial contact.
Enter the contact address of the speed dial contact. The contact address may be a phone number or IP address depending on the resource.
The label displays beside the line key to identify the speed dial contact.
Choose a ringtone for the speed dial contact.
When enabled, incoming calls from this Contact Address are automatically forwarded to the address you enter here.
Enable or disable the Auto-Reject feature. When enabled, incoming calls from this Contact Address are rejected. Auto-divert, if enabled, has precedence over Auto-Reject.

Enable or disable the Auto-Divert feature. If enabled, incoming calls from this Contact Address will automatically be forwarded to the address specified in Divert Contact. Auto-divert, if enabled, has precedence over Auto-Reject.
Enable or disable the Buddy block feature. If enabled, you can block contacts from viewing your status.
Enable or disable the Buddy watch feature. If enabled, you can monitor the status of contacts.
Enter a label for the EFK line key. This label will display beside the EFK line key.
From the drop-down menu, choose a function for the EFK line key.
Enter a label to identify the BLF contact. This label will display beside the line key for that BLF contact.
Enter the address of the BLF contact you want to subscribe to and monitor.

From the drop-down menu, specify whether the BLF contact is normal or automata. The resource type you choose determines the function of the line key.

Normal: When you press the BLF line key, the phone will initiate a call to that contact if the user is in the idle or busy state. If that contact's phone is ringing, you can answer that call, a directed call pickup. If you are in an active call, pressing the BLF line key places the active call on hold.

Automata: When you press the BLF line key during an active call will initiate a call park/blind transfer. If you are not in an active call, and the monitored resource is ringing or busy, you can press the BLF line key to perform a park retrieval/directed call pickup.
The line key type.
Enter a label to identify the registered line for this line key. This label will display beside the line key for this registered line.
Specify the number of line appearances that will display for this registered line.
The IP address or the host name of a SIP server that accepts registration requests.
The syslog server IP address or host name.
The protocol that the phone will use to write to the syslog server. If set to None, transmission is turned off, but the server address is preserved.
A description of what generated the log message. The default value is 16, which maps to local 0.
Specifies the lowest class of event that will be rendered to syslog. It is based on log.render.level and can be a lower value.
If enabled, the phone's MAC address is prepended to the log message sent to the syslog server.
You can define the log level for the Dot1x log. The default logging level for the Dot1x log is Minor Error.
In the drop-down menu, select the country that the phone is located in
You can choose whether to format vendor-identifying information in RFC 3925 or ASCII.
Unused: To move an unused audio codec to the In Use field, click on the audio codec in the Unused field, and then click the right-pointing arrow. The audio codec displays in the In Use field.

In Use: To remove an audio codec from the In Use field, click on the audio codec in the In Use field, and then click the left-pointing arrow. The audio codec displays in the Unused field.
To change the priority of an audio codec, click on the audio codec, and then click the up or down arrow.
Unused: To move an unused video codec to the In Use field, click on the video codec in the Unused field, and then click the right-pointing arrow. The video codec displays in the In Use field.

In Use: To remove a video codec from the In Use field, click on the video codec in the In Use field, and then click the left-pointing arrow. The video codec displays in the Unused field.
To change the priority of a video codec, click on the video codec, and then click the up or down arrow.
Choose CA Certificates or Device Certificates as a valid source for authenticating the server.

Choose CA Certificates or Device Certificates as a valid source for authenticating the server.
The Device Certificate option is used for MTLS.

You can enable access to an exchange server to view your Exchange Calendar. On the Exchange Calendar, you can access meeting information and dial into a conference and can manage your meetings and conferences.
Enter the URL of the exchange server you want to access.
Enter the URL of an application Web page you want to display on your phone's Applications menu.
The application name you enter here displays as a label on the phone's applications menu.
Enter the URL/file name located in provisioning server.
The week you specify here will be the start week of daylight savings time used by the phone.
The week you specify here will be the stop week of daylight savings time used by the phone.

From the drop-down menu, choose the default cipher or a custom cipher for Application Profile.
Enable/Disable the display of exchange calendar reminders.

Enter the address of the H.323 gatekeeper. If this value is empty, the phone will use the value set in the global H.323 gatekeeper address: Settings > H.323 > Gatekeeper Settings.
The port to be used for H.323 signaling. If '0' is used, 1719 (H.323 RAS signaling) is used.
Enter the old password.
Phone state to configure softkeys.
Allows to choose a background color for phone and expansion module if supported.
Allows to choose a background image for phone and expansion module if supported.
Displays configured phone image file names. On selection of the row in this list box, the selected 'Phone' image will be displayed in the 'Phone Preivew'.
Displays configured expansion module image file names. On selection of the row in this list box, the selected 'Expansion Module' image will be displayed in the 'Extension Module Preivew'.

Displays the selected phone image/background color.
Displays the selected expansion module image/background color.

Request a time period, in seconds, after which the phone's registration with the server will expire. When this field is empty, the phone will use the time set in the global expiry: Settings > H.323 > Gatekeeper Settings.

Export configuration files to another phone. From the drop-down menu, choose the source of the configuration files you want to export from. Once you have chosen the source, click on the Export button. All sources is the default.
Configure the CA certificate platform profile from the options on the right. Only one CA certificate option may be selected for each platform CA.
Configure the CA certificate application profile from the options on the right. You can select multiple CA certificates for each application CA.
The audio file to be played as welcome sound when a phone reboots or restarts.
Specify the type of device connected to the 2.5mm jack on the side of the phone.
Choose whether the phone is to operate using PSTN or SIP. If you choose Auto, the phone will automatically operate according to the port you plug into. The default is Auto.
Enter the new password. Minimum length of password field is dependent on sec.pwd.length.user value.
